Posts.Content: Rockysg1 wrote: Hello Everyone, I am so happy I found this site. I have 3 painful lumps that I found in my left breast and I just had an ultrasound and mammogram (7/6/11) that came back with a BI RADS 5 result: suspicious for multifocal and possibily multicentric carcinoma with possible metastasis to the left axillary lymph node (5 lumps were found all under 1cm and the lymph node is 3.3cmx1.4cmx.08cm with fatty hilum and thickening of its cortex). I am 34 and active in the military stationed in the Virgin Islands. Unfortunately for me the islands do no not have adequate care and I have to wait for the military to approve me to go to the states for further tests. I know I have to wait to get further testing to make sure I am positive for carcinoma but wonder what the chances are of all the lumps and the large mass being B9. I don't know but I am trying to remain hopeful but still looking at holistic approaches to treatment just in case :0) Dx 8/5/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/22 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2011 06:50PM Rockysg1 wrote: Missy, Thank You so much for your response, I am seeking any glimmer of hope for this to be "nothing big" so again thank you.
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2011 12:32AM Rockysg1 wrote: I am scheduled for Monday, Oct 3rd. BMX and Recon

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2011 05:04AM Rockysg1 wrote: Thank you guys so much for your support. As I write this I am packing, moving my family from a hotel to a house I found in just the nick of time (Yesterday, life works out even when it looks like its not I guess)). I am being transferred from the USVI (St. Croix) to DC (I'm in the military) for treatment. My thoughts and best wishes are with everyone scheduled for surgery this month. I will give an update tomorrow if I don't get a chance to post again today. I don't have internet in the other house yet:)
Posts.Title: Any October 2011 Surgeries out there want to wait together? gamergirl GrandmaV

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 09:36PM Rockysg1 wrote: Hello Everyone, I just had my biopsy done today. I have multiple tumors in my left breast. 6 samples were taken from two and cells were also extracted from a curious lymph node (ouch!). I overheard the person analyzing the cells say they look like cancer and the radiologist told me that she will be surprised if it was anything other than cancer. I was prepared for that news but of course still have to wait for the actual results next Thursday but will hopefully hear yea or nay for sure on Monday.
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 10:41PM Rockysg1 wrote: Cycle, Yes, I know I  am actually not in the dumps over this, everything happens for a reason. I am more upset over my plans for military schools I am scheduled for this year:( I know everything will be alright.
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 01:24PM Rockysg1 wrote: Hello Guys, I am so sorry I did not post yesterday but I got a little busy with school and bombarded with phone calls later in the eve. I am POSITIVE for carcinoma which I figured I am still waiting for the lymph node cultures to come back to see if it spread but I think I know the answer to that as well. Overall I am still in good spirits no crying, but I think I just haven't wrapped my head around this yet as far as the serverity of the situation. I hope I can actually maintain this attitude...lol. Again guys thank you so much for your support, No sorries please it's no ones fault and I don't like sympathy just ears out there to listen so again thank you so much:) Carp: I won't be able to make it there on Wed but I have my appointment at 0800 with the "team" so if you have time or work close let me know, I'm sure I'll run into you sooner or later:)
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 02:36AM Rockysg1 wrote: I wish I could just go there to get the results but I am 130 miles away at Fort Lee, VA and it's a military hospital so I am use to the ridiculous treatment but I can't believe this. Well I will post my results tomorrow eve when I return from school...thanks guys again for all your support...you are all wonderful!!!

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 12:12AM Rockysg1 wrote: Can you believe I have been calling all day today for my biopsy results and no one had them. Finally the doctor called me while I was in class and left a message stating she had the results. I called her back 10 minutes later and she left for the day and no one else could give me the results...

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2011 06:21AM Rockysg1 wrote: Good Evening Ladies, I am so sorry to post so late after surgery just got my internet up and running in the new home. Post Surgery was more painful than expected and I ended up with 4 drainage tubes instead of 2 and I still have them:( but overall I feel better everyday and have been doing my regular chores including driving since day 3 after surgery. Trinity and Survivor thank you for taking this journey with me my thoughts were of you guys on surgery day as well, and everyone who has had or is pending surgery this month godspeed...I pray for your quick recovery.
